text: hello everyone today I'm going to
demonstrate Amazon detective capability
to have finding groups that include
Amazon inspector Network reachability
and software vulnerability findings
alongside Amazon God Duty findings
if you're not familiar Amazon detective
simplifies the investigative process and
helps security teams conduct faster and
more effective investigations by helping
us analyze investigate and quickly
identify the root cause of security
findings or suspicious activities
Amazon detective finding groups enable
you to examine multiple activities as
they relate to a single security
compromise event
by combining Amazon inspector findings
with God Duty findings finding groups
help you understand if threats
identified by guard Duty were caused by
software vulnerabilities or publicly
exposed ec2 instances so this capability
will help us investigate further into
Amazon inspector vulnerability findings
with the Amazon detective pre-built data
aggregations summaries and context you
can quickly analyze and determine the
nature and extent of possible security
issues
to get started I will select the Amazon
detective service in the AWS console
when you select Amazon detective in the
AWS console you are presented with this
summary page you will see view all
finding groups this will take you to the
finding groups page with all the finding
groups you can also use finding groups
tab from the menu on the left
detective analyzes data from findings
and groups them with other findings that
are likely to be related based on
resources they share in addition to
findings each group includes entities
involved by the findings the entities
can include resources outside of AWS
such as IP addresses or user agents I'll
go ahead and select one of the finding
group
here we can see details such as finding
group ID and scope time it also provides
us with interactive visualization from
where we can select and see details
about each item in the finding group
below this we can view all the entities
involved with the finding group such as
instance ID VPC ID account ID
Etc and using this information we know
exactly what resources were affected by
the security findings for example I can
see instance ID here and if I select
this instance
this will take you to details about the
instance such as Associated VPC and all
findings associated with this instance
here we can see the vulnerability
findings from Amazon inspector and if we
select the finding this will take us to
specific details about this particular
Amazon inspector findings where we will
have all the information which we can
use to further investigate this finding
such as severity types and related
findings as well as remediation steps
which makes it easier for us in
remediating these findings
and that's it today we learned how
Amazon detective has expanded finding
groups to include Amazon inspector
findings to simplify remediation efforts
to learn more about Amazon detective
finding groups please visit Amazon
detective documentation link provided
here thank you
